answers.answer: Maybe she just needs some time to process the fact that you are pregnant and how it will affect everything. And maybe she doesn't realize she is coming off as mean, she could probably word things differently. I hope it gets better for you. If not, you could always try talking to her if that is something you would be comfortable with.

It doesn't sound negative at , infact it sounds more like she's giving you advice, I know as a ftm im getting advice from everyone and everything from what shoes to wear to sleeping positions. Tbh I think your boss is just trying to pass on information she learned.

Different people react in different manner. Like my boss treats me like I hav some deadly illness. Over protective..trust me I hate it. Gosh..I m just pregnant not paralysed. But can't do much.. do wats best suited for u n ur baby..others can just be ignored at d moment..
It sounds more like she's concerned to me. I know its irritating to be told wat to do. N it seems everybody has some piece of advice wen ur pregnant bt try to take it positively.
It sounds more like she's concerned to me. I know its irritating to be told wat to do. N it seems everybody has some piece of advice wen ur pregnant bt try to take it positively.

It sounds like she is concerned more than anything. The snacks you are eating are high in carbs and sugar (which you will have to limit if not eliminate if diagnosed with gestational diabetes-which I was)...  granola bars have much more carbs and the process of dehydrating fruits concentratea all the sugars into small bites... trust me, you dont want gestational diabetes--- its a pain to deal with

Your 10 weeks along honestly you don't need to start worrying about what your eating yet. I'm 32+2 and I have a mixture of what I eat and yes honestly I eat a lot of sugar and have since the beginning of my pregnancy and have nothing wrong. My Dr actually tells me that I still need to eat more because um not very big. I look like I'm 5 or 6 months when I'm actually 8 months. Don't let anyone get you down. Congrats on the pregnancy and just keep your head up.

Usually you can still do the same as b4 until a bit further into your pregnancy.  Everyone is different and when ur Dr tells you to lay off and do less make sure you get a Dr's note right away. I'm a cosmetologist and up until my BP went up at 24 weeks I did all the stuff and 10+ hrs a day I normally did. I have had to decrease hrs bc of hbp and swollen legs but will still throw in a 8 or 10 hr day here or there. I actually do living when supplies come in to put the boxes away etc but usually the girls I work with try to do it so I won't (at this point.) Good luck w the boss.
Someone is jelious because she doesn't have any kids sorry to be mean but it's true alot of people r haters when someone is pregnant and there not so don't worry about it she is just being a hater

question: So i told my boss i was pregnant a week and a half ago and that im 10 weeks along. In that short period of time she has stated i can do anything i used to ex. Lifting and unpacking shipment and longer shifts ie 10 hours on my feet. And tonight she said i would regret snacking. The snacks im eating are grapes, banana, dried apricots and granola bars. And i only have 2 of them. One before my break and one after. My meals have been light and usually left overs or microwave meals like lean cuisine. I could understand if i was eating potato chips and mcdonalds for every meal, but im not. I havemt had a french fry in weeks. She and i got along great before i was pregnant, i just dont get where all of her negativity is coming from, and its really getting me down.  She is a mother of two grown children,  i really thought she would be more supportiveAny thoughts?
title: my boss is not happy
